**Disclaimer:** This sell-side report was generated using Grok 4.1 Fast Reasoning (grok-4-1-fast-reasoning). Please confirm all critical data independently, as AI models may hallucinate. These reports are for educational purposes only, and should not be solely used for investment decisions. Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly. For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI --- # Spire Inc. (NYSE: SRI) Sell-Side Analysis Report **Current Stock Metrics** (as of October 14, 2024 close, sourced from Yahoo Finance and NYSE): - Stock Price: $63.27 - Market Capitalization: $3.39 billion - 52-Week Range: $53.00 - $70.03 - Avg. Daily Volume: 248,000 shares ## Company Overview (187 words) Spire Inc. (NYSE: SRI) is a prominent U.S. natural gas utility company primarily operating in the Midwest and Southeast. Its core Gas Utility segment serves approximately 1.45 million customers across Missouri (1.3 million) and Alabama (145,000), providing regulated natural gas distribution, transportation, and storage services. This segment accounts for nearly all of Spire's revenue post the March 2024 divestiture of its non-utility Gas Marketing business to Hartree Partners for $510 million. Spire Missouri is the state's largest natural gas distributor, while Spire Alabama focuses on residential, commercial, and industrial customers. The company invests heavily in infrastructure modernization, safety enhancements, and renewable natural gas (RNG) initiatives to support decarbonization. With a regulated model, Spire benefits from stable rate cases and allowed ROEs (e.g., 9.9% in recent MO settlement). FY2024 revenue was ~$2.7 billion (pre-divestiture impact), driven by customer growth (1-2% annually) and capex. Spire emphasizes reliability amid weather volatility, as seen in recent hurricane responses, positioning it as a defensive utility play in a sector facing rising natural gas demand from LNG exports, power generation, and data centers. ## Recent Developments - **August 7, 2024**: Q1 FY2025 earnings (quarter ended June 30, 2024) reported consolidated net income of $21.5 million ($0.44 diluted EPS, beating consensus $0.21) and Gas Utility net income of $44.4 million. Revenues totaled $663.1 million (down YoY due to marketing sale). Adjusted operating income rose 11% YoY to $90.5 million. - **October 10, 2024**: Completed 100% service restoration for Alabama customers impacted by Hurricane Helene; earlier restored operations post-Hurricane Idalia (August 2024). - **September 24, 2024**: Missouri PSC approved $58 million annual revenue increase via infrastructure tracker, supporting $1.7 billion 5-year capex plan. - **July 2024**: Closed $510 million Gas Marketing sale, reducing debt by $400 million and improving leverage to 3.6x. - **November 7, 2024 (upcoming)**: Q2 FY2025 earnings expected; consensus EPS $1.02. ## Growth Strategy - **Infrastructure Investment**: $600-650 million FY2025 capex (up from $547 million FY2024), targeting pipe replacement (70 miles in MO Q1), smart meters, and cybersecurity. - **Customer Expansion**: Organic growth of 1-1.5% annually; targeting industrial conversions amid electrification. - **RNG and Sustainability**: Scaling renewable natural gas via partnerships (e.g., Veolia); first RNG facility operational in Missouri (2023). - **Rate Recovery**: Multi-year dockets â€“ MO Phase 2 (2025, $100M+ request), AL general rate case filing planned H1 2025. - **Financial Targets**: FY2025 EPS guidance $4.20-$4.50 (midpoint +5% YoY); long-term 6-8% EPS CAGR through 2028 via capex and efficiency. ## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds | Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds | |--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **Company** | - Post-sale deleveraging (net debt $3.1B, leverage 3.6x).
- Hurricane response boosts reliability rep.
- RNG pilots position for green transition. | - Weather-normalization impacts Q1 earnings.
- High capex strains FCF (~$200M FY2025 est.).
- Regulatory lag in AL (last case 2017). | | **Sector** | - Rising natgas demand (LNG +10 Bcf/d exports; data centers +20% gas use).
- Utility deregulation tailwinds in MO.
- Low interest sensitivity post-Fed cuts. | - Mild weather volatility (Q1 2025 warmer).
- Commodity price swings (Henry Hub ~$2.80/MMBtu).
- ESG pressure on fossil fuels; rising capex inflation (+5%). | ## Existing Products/Services - **Natural Gas Distribution**: Residential (80% volume), commercial/industrial (15%), transportation (5%). - **Storage & Transmission**: 20 Bcf storage capacity in MO. - **Infrastructure Services**: Pipeline maintenance (wind-down post-marketing sale). ## New Products/Services/Projects - **RNG Facilities**: Missouri landfill RNG plant (operational 2024, 1 MMcf/d capacity); expansion to 5+ sites by 2027. - **Hydrogen Blending Pilots**: Testing 5-20% blends in AL pipelines (2025 rollout). - **Smart Grid Upgrades**: 100,000+ AMI meters by FY2026. - **Data Center Outreach**: Targeting MO hyperscalers for direct gas service (RFPs issued 2024). ## Market Share Approximations & Forecast - **Current Share**: ~46% of Missouri residential natgas market (1.3M of 2.8M customers); ~25% Alabama market (145k customers in 580k total). - **Forecast**: Stable-to-slight growth to 47-48% MO by 2026 (via conversions); AL to 27% with rate case. Sector natgas distribution growth ~1.5% CAGR; Spire to match/outpace via capex. No major share erosion expected; utilities are territorial monopolies. ## Comparison to Competitors | Metric | Spire (SRI) | Atmos Energy (ATO) | CenterPoint (CNP) | NiSource (NI) | |-------------------------|-------------|---------------------|-------------------|---------------| | **Market Cap** | $3.39B | $21.5B | $19.2B | $12.1B | | **Customers (Gas)** | 1.45M | 3.3M | 3.4M (multi-fuel)| 3.3M | | **FY25 EPS Growth Est**| 5% | 6% | 8% | 7% | | **Yield** | 4.1% | 2.3% | 2.8% | 3.4% | | **ROE** | 8.2% | 9.1% | 9.5% | 8.9% | | **Edge** | High yield, MO dominance | Scale, TX growth | Diversified | Midwest RNG | Spire lags in scale but trades at discount (12x FY25 EV/EBITDA vs. peers 14-16x); stronger dividend (4.1% yield, 65% payout). ## Partnerships, M&A, Clients - **Partnerships**: Veolia (RNG production, 2023 MOU); Shell (prior marketing, transitioned 2024). - **M&A**: Sold Gas Marketing to Hartree (March 29, 2024, $510M); no major buys since 2013 AL acquisition. - **Major Clients**: Industrial (Boeing, Anheuser-Busch in MO); utilities (Spire interconnects with Enable Midstream). Potential: Data centers (Google, Meta scouting MO/AL sites, 2024). - **Qualitative**: Strong ESG (S&P BBB rating); employee-owned culture; top-quartile safety (OSHA recordable rate 0.4). ## Recommendation - **Buy Rating**: 4/10 (Hold). Limited growth upside (5-7% CAGR) in mature utility; defensive yield appeals but lacks strong catalysts for aggressive portfolios. Moderate risk from weather/regulations offset by deleveraging. - **Fair Value Estimate**: $70 (10% upside). Based on 15x FY25 EPS midpoint ($4.35) + 4% yield premium; DCF implies $68-72 assuming 6% EPS growth, 3.6x leverage stabilization.
